description.narrative: By 2022, child development and pre-school education institutions offer relevant services for children and their families, with coordination mechanisms, quality standards and programs to support institutional capacity-building., which contributes to Early Childhood Development, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, the most vulnerable and excluded children and adolescents have access to, remain and complete their early childhood development and pre-school and secondary education responding to their needs, potential and intercultural contexts.

participating-org.narrative: FUNDACION DE UNIVERSIDAD COSTA RICA PARA LA INVESTIGACION

related-activity.ref: 1020/A0/06/001 INCLUSIVE EARLY CHILDHOOD DEVELOPMENT AND EDUCATION.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, child development and pre-school education institutions offer relevant services for children and their families, with coordination mechanisms, quality standards and programs to support institutional capacity-building.

description.narrative: During 2019, UNICEF focused its attention on universalizing preschool education by developing a campaign aimed at raising the awareness of parents and caregivers on the importance of enrolling children at this level; in 2020 full coverage of preschool-aged population is expected. UNICEF also strengthened the coordination and leadership role of the National Child Care and Development Network (REDCUDI) by developing standardized curriculum, teaching, human resource and information system tools and guidelines. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:10/02/2020

title.narrative: Percentage of children attended by the Childcare Network.
Percentage of children between the age of 4.3 and 6.3 in pre-school education.
Country using the ECD Index (MICS) to report on SDG target 4.2.1 (early childhood development)

baseline.value: The ECD obtained in the 2011 survey was used in the development of the National Early Childhood Policy

target.value: 2022:Through the second measurement of the ECD in 2018, the baseline of the policy can be tracked.

title.narrative: Action Plan of the National Early Childhood Development Policy in execution, with an intersectoral approach and defined quality standards.

baseline.value: The National Early Childhood DevelopmentPolicy 2015-2020, approved on March 22, 2017, does not yet have an Action Plan

target.value: 2019:Action Plan approved and in execution by 2019.

actual.value: 2019:UNICEF has had a meeting with PANI to review their Work Plan, and PANI has defined the focal point for the reactivation of the Interinstitutional Commission for the generation of the Early Childhood Policy Action Plan. This action will start the activities to get impulse to that Action Plan.

title.narrative: Action Plan of the National Early Childhood Development Policy in execution, with an intersectoral approach and defined quality standards.

baseline.value: The National Early Childhood DevelopmentPolicy 2015-2020, approved on March 22, 2017, does not yet have an Action Plan

target.value: 2019:Action Plan approved and in execution by 2019.

actual.value: 2019:UNICEF has had meetings with the authorities of the Ministry of Health and the Social Security Administration of Costa Rica to reactivate the inter-institucional network in charge of desinging the Action Plan for the National Early Childhood Development Policy.
